content:
Ok so this is how I made a dictionary based brute force attack
First i needed to find the targets ip-address. In this example its a simple server on my lan next I opened kali linux on virtual box and scanned what ports are open on the server by typing in this command nmap 192.168.1.116 after that I can see that ports 22 and 80 are open. Commonly 22 is used for remote access and 80 is used for http traffic after knowing this I can try bruteforcing ssh access In this case because I dont want to wait forever I have created a simpler list of passwords that might be the correct one. You can also use rockyou.txt that has over 14miljon passwords to try Next i typed in this command to start the bruteforce attack. (in this case i know that the ssh username is pi so i specify that in the command) hydra -l pi -P passwords.txt -t 4 192.168.1.116 ssh After that i get the correct password printed in the console. Now I can use this information to gain access using putty
summary:
Ok so this is how I made a dictionary based brute force attack
First i needed to find the targets ip-address. In this example its a simple server on my lan next I opened kali linux on virtual box and scanned what ports are open on the server by typing in this command nmap 192.168.1.116 after that I can see that ports 22 and 80 are open. Commonly 22 is used for remote access and 80 is used for http traffic after knowing this I can try bruteforcing ssh access In this case because I dont want to wait forever I have created a simpler list of passwords that might be the correct one.
title: Simple dictionary bruteforce attack

content:
To better follow this you should first read this
Ok… First make sure youre in the correct place: cd /var/www/html in this example I’m going to host just two sites but you can host as many as you want… In this example i want to have one site in domain ju5tu5.net and another at test.ju5tu5.net
So to host two sites make a folder for each different site you want to make like in the picture: then place your website files in each of these folder
next we need to change the directory we are in:
cd ~ cd /etc/apache2/sites-available/ when inside this folder make a copy of the existing 000-default.conf file so you have two files according to the picture or as many files as you wish to have different websites: Now lets modify the first by typing this command:
sudo nano 000-default.conf In nano paste this in the the file(change the ServerName to your domain name where you want the website to run, and change DocumentRoot to the location where your website files are located): <VirtualHost *:80># The ServerName directive sets the request scheme, hostname and port that# the server uses to identify itself. This is used when creating# redirection URLs. In the context of virtual hosts, the ServerName# specifies what hostname must appear in the request's Host: header to# match this virtual host. For the default virtual host (this file) this# value is not decisive as it is used as a last resort host regardless.# However, you must set it for any further virtual host explicitly.ServerName ju5tu5.netServerAdmin webmaster@localhostDocumentRoot /var/www/html/ju5tu5.net# Available loglevels: trace8, ..., trace1, debug, info, notice, warn,# error, crit, alert, emerg.# It is also possible to configure the loglevel for particular# modules, e.g.#LogLevel info ssl:warnErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.logCustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined# For most configuration files from conf-available/, which are# enabled or disabled at a global level, it is possible to# include a line for only one particular virtual host. For example the# following line enables the CGI configuration for this host only# after it has been globally disabled with "a2disconf".#Include conf-available/serve-cgi-bin.conf</VirtualHost># vim: syntax=apache ts=4 sw=4 sts=4 sr noet Now save changes and do this for the same website also: sudo nano 001-default.conf and then then (also remember to make the same changes here) <VirtualHost *:80># The ServerName directive sets the request scheme, hostname and port that# the server uses to identify itself. This is used when creating# redirection URLs. In the context of virtual hosts, the ServerName# specifies what hostname must appear in the request's Host: header to# match this virtual host. For the default virtual host (this file) this# value is not decisive as it is used as a last resort host regardless.# However, you must set it for any further virtual host explicitly.ServerName test.ju5tu5.netServerAdmin webmaster@localhostDocumentRoot /var/www/html/test# Available loglevels: trace8, ..., trace1, debug, info, notice, warn,# error, crit, alert, emerg.# It is also possible to configure the loglevel for particular# modules, e.g.#LogLevel info ssl:warnErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.logCustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined# For most configuration files from conf-available/, which are# enabled or disabled at a global level, it is possible to# include a line for only one particular virtual host. For example the# following line enables the CGI configuration for this host only# after it has been globally disabled with "a2disconf".#Include conf-available/serve-cgi-bin.conf</VirtualHost># vim: syntax=apache ts=4 sw=4 sts=4 sr noet Now to apply these changes run these commands: sudo a2ensite 000-default.conf sudo a2ensite 001-default.conf sudo systemctl restart apache2 ok now you need to make sure that you have the domains set up correctly in your dns provider so both web addresses are pointing to your servers ip address. test.ju5tu5.net and ju5tu5.net in my case

Ok… First make sure youre in the correct place: cd /var/www/html in this example I’m going to host just two sites but you can host as many as you want… In this example i want to have one site in domain ju5tu5.net and another at test.ju5tu5.net
So to host two sites make a folder for each different site you want to make like in the picture: then place your website files in each of these folder

content:
go to the directory on your computer where your hugo site files are located. Cmd on that directory and use the command:
hugo -D get you public folder and its files to github Use PUTTY to access your server by typing in the ip address of your server. Next run these commands to make sure that the software is uptodate:
sudo apt update sudo apt upgrade Next install apache2, git and PHP by running these commands sudo apt install apache2 -y sudo apt install git -y sudo apt install php -y After this you can go to your server ip address on your browser and you should see this: Now navigate to the correct directory by using this command:
cd /var/www/html After that you can run this command to clear the directory: sudo rm * Now we want to get the files from github by using this command(you need to replace the link with your own repository link): sudo git clone https://github.com/Aqentjus/ju5tu5.net.git Now you need to make it so the www directory eventually looks like this: I achieved this using these commands so they might be helpful for you too:
ls -l cd ju5tu5.net/public/ sudo cp * ../.. -R cd ../.. ls -l sudo rm ju5tu5.net/ -R after this if everything went right when visiting your servers ip address you should see your website:
summary:
go to the directory on your computer where your hugo site files are located. Cmd on that directory and use the command:
hugo -D get you public folder and its files to github Use PUTTY to access your server by typing in the ip address of your server. Next run these commands to make sure that the software is uptodate:
sudo apt update sudo apt upgrade Next install apache2, git and PHP by running these commands sudo apt install apache2 -y sudo apt install git -y sudo apt install php -y After this you can go to your server ip address on your browser and you should see this: Now navigate to the correct directory by using this command:
title: Host a website on linux

content:
As a guy who loves to watch different movies and tv shows I created this static website do display the movies that i have watched over the years.
The website shows basic stats like the movie name, release date and a poster image. I also added to show the rating of what i though about that specific movie. This data is received using the TMDB (the movie database) apikey.
My watched movies

content: I’m a very big Marvel fan myself. My favorites are doctor strange and Iron Man. One day I watched a youtube video and it showed how to build Iron man’s arc reactor using a 3d printer. I downloaded the file and immediately got excited about the project. To original video! In the first step, I actually started by printing the body of the arc reactor. Next I had to get an EL panel for my project. Huge thanks to Jari, who took care of it for me. Next, I started to cut the electric panel so that it fits the frame. The cutting instructions from the video were small as shown in the picture, so I had to draw my own. Next, Jari enlarged the holes in the back panel for me, because I was nervous that I would screw something up badly here. In the same class, I also filed the hole where the wires of the el panel are threaded to be bigger, and the frame to be put on it smaller so that it fits in the case. At the end of the class, I went to paint the work. With gray spray paint. At home I modeled how the finished work would look like. In the next lesson, I built a wire that takes electricity from the battery case that is in my pocket to the el panel. Here I used a soldering iron and a hot air blower. at home I filled the hole with this mass because the hole had to be made really big because the hole was blocked. In the next lesson, I soldered a connector to the el panel so I can easily separate the parts from each other. I also printed a stand for the reactor so I can display it on a shelf in my room. At home today, May 9, 2022, I started gluing the magnets to the back plate and the arc reactor itself, so that I can attach it to my shirt. Next, I added a film on top of the el panel, which brings a little more privacy to the light. I wiped the el panel with a microfiber cloth and then put the top part in place… And WOW that looks amazing!
summary: I’m a very big Marvel fan myself. My favorites are doctor strange and Iron Man. One day I watched a youtube video and it showed how to build Iron man’s arc reactor using a 3d printer. I downloaded the file and immediately got excited about the project. To original video! In the first step, I actually started by printing the body of the arc reactor. Next I had to get an EL panel for my project.
title: Iron Man: arc reactor
